conclusion: Understanding how shadow position and size change when the light source moves backward above the objects.
Shadow position will move forward as the light source moves backward.
Shadow size will become smaller as the light source moves farther away.
Shadow A is cast by the cylindrical object on the left.
Shadow A will move forward and become smaller as the light source moves backward.
Shadow B is cast by the spherical object on the right.
Shadow B will move forward and become smaller as the light source moves backward.
Shadow C is cast by the person's foot.
Shadow C will move forward and become smaller as the light source moves backward.
Shadow D is cast by the square object on the right.
Shadow D will move forward and become smaller as the light source moves backward.
Final answer: Shadow A, B, C, and D will move forward and become smaller.
